Duration.description: This is the time (in minutes) for the condition to persist before triggering an event.

Operator.description: This determines what comparison will be used between the ValueFunction and the Threshold value to trigger an event.

Priority.description: This corresponds to the severity level selected when setting the Threshold values.

Threshold.description: This is the threshold that the ValueFunction must be compared to using the Operator for an event to be triggered.

TimeFunction.description: This corresponds to the Threshold values.

description: Resource schema to create a NewRelic NRQL-based Alert

ApiKey.description: A New Relic REST API Key

PolicyId.description: Identifier of the New Relic Alert Policy

Enabled.description: This is the status of your alert condition and is optional. The default is false.

ExpectedGroups.description: This is the number of groups you expect to see at any given time. It is used in combination with the OpenViolationOnGroupOverlay option.

IgnoreOverlap.description: If disabled, New Relic looks for a convergence of groups. If the condition is looking for 2 or more groups, and the returned values cannot be separated into that number of distinct groups, then that will also produce a violation.

Name.description: This is a title for your condition and will allow you identify it in the New Relics Alerts UI.

Query.description: This is the NRQL query that New Relic Alerts monitors as part of a NRQL condition.

SinceValue.description: This is the time (in minutes) for the condition to persist before triggering an event.

Type.description: This defines the type of metric that will be used for the alert.

ValueFunction.description: Function to be applied to the Threshold values.

ViolationTimeLimitSeconds.description: Use to automatically close instance-based violations after the number of seconds specified.
